summary: The document is an FBI communication from September 26, 1961, detailing the suppression of gambling activities in New Kensington, PA, linked to individuals associated with the Mannarino brothers. It highlights a notable decrease in gambling operations, the apprehension among gamblers regarding potential federal indictments due to an IRS probe, and the legal consultation by Willie Sams, identified as the key figure in the Mannarino gambling network. The document also warns that the individuals involved are armed and dangerous.
key_findings: Significant suppression of gambling activities in New Kensington, PA, as reported by a PCI.
Gambling activities reduced to about twenty-five percent of normal levels from a month prior.
Fear among gamblers of federal indictment due to an extensive IRS investigation.
Willie Sams, associated with the Mannarino brothers, consulted an attorney believing he was under investigation.
Subjects involved are considered armed and dangerous.
